reviewBody: Product is very nice and easy to install. Packaging was fine and in very good condition. But price should be less. For Prime members, the delivery of product should take less time. Overall, I am satisfied with the product. Anyone can try without any problem.

reviewTitles: True Work Horse, But Read This Before you Buy! - I bought this for 8000 INR | Worth it?
reviewBody: Bought this in 2020 - still working fine (2023 FEB)- I got TP-Link RE650 HW - V1My main WiFi router is on the first floor.I was not getting enough coverage for TV etc. On the ground floor.I Tested 5Ghz as a backhaul to the 5Ghz band to the main router, and the results were 200 to 300 Mbps speed from the main router.Then I tested the 2.4Ghz band as backhaul to the main router, and the results were much better, close to 450 Mbps up and 550 Mbps down.When I tested this device as AP, I got 900+ Mbps down on 5GHz.This is a really solid device.You can put all your Smart Home / IoT devices on the 2.4 GHz channel and use it as backhaul! to the main router or use a wired connection and use it as a Powerful AP.Suppose you live in a Flat where multiple WiFi channels are competing for AIR space. Get a WiFi6/6E device.This is a very good WiFi5 device. Now you can buy it at a very discounted price. ( I paid 8000 INR in 2020 )How to Install?First, check the device firmware and update it (The new version is available on the TP-Link website). Always check the Hardware version before downloading and updating the hardware.Use WiFi analyser app on Android (OpenSource)And find a less congested 2.4GHz channel, and use that channel for backhaul.Also, find and use a less congested 5Gz channel and use it for the 5Ghz band.Then use OpenSpeedTest-Server to test Local Network. And choose the best-performing location and channel after testing multiple combinations for maximum performance.Use the 5Ghz band for maximum devices except for IoT.

Okay product but not worth at full price. The range is good with 2.4 GHz signal....for a normal 3 BHK Indian flat with cement walls, it will suffice in all corners. The 5GHz signal falls short of expectation, with 4 powerful antennas and a huge size body, the range is almost the same as my phone's 5Ghz hotspot signal.Other than that the usual gripe of extenders still continues. It has to be switched on and off every couple of days or it drops the internet connectivity. The installation is extremely easy using Tether app, so that's good. My unit had to be reset when new for 5Ghz signal to turn on but this issue never came up again.Overall - The unit does what it is supposed to do but at full price, I expected the 5GHz signal strength to be more. It fails to penetrate more than 1 cement wall. So the signal will only be in the room it is installed in and the adjacent one. Anything after that, use the 2.4 GHz signal.I had a small extender from TP Link itself earlier...the one with 2 antennas protruding out of it.....the range is same as that.....so save some money and purchase the smaller one instead. As far as speed it considered, I have a max internet speed of 150Mbps and both extenders delivered that at 5Ghz. If you require more speed, maybe you will notice a difference, I didn't.It also boasts of other features like MIMO beamforming but the main point of signal strength fails so those don't matter to me even if they work.

reviewTitles: Expensive WiFi extender but with good coverage
reviewBody: The TP-Link RE650 is pretty expensive for what it does. Been using it for a week.**IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT THE HARDWARE VERSION IS v1.0 AND DOES NOT HAVE ANY MESH WIFI FEATURES.**Here are my observations:1. Easy to install and configure. The Web UI is easy to use but pretty dumbed down.2. It is quite heavy.3. Range is quite decent. Has a 'boost' mode which is not well documented. In 'boost' mode, you connect to 2.4Ghz and extend on the 5Ghz band. Check the TP link online KB articles for this. That is how I am using it.4. Can set it to have its own DHCP Server and static IP.5. When not using a DHCP, it can take a long time to provide an IP address to a device which connects to it. This issue could also be due to the range.All in all, the TP-Link RE650 is easy to use and does what it is supposed to but I feel it is terribly expensive. I also own a Mi Router 4A High-Speed Dual Band AC1200 Router on which I have installed OpenWRT. I can configure it to give me the same features as the TP-Link RE650 and more. But if you are not a power user and just want to buy a plug-and-play device, this is good.
Sometime it lose signal and turn red and we have to restart it .. This happen one or two time a month.. But overall experience is good ..

reviewTitles: 5G band Wifi channels above 100 cannot be detected -not compatible to all router in 5Ghz
reviewBody: The performance of the product is not upto the mark, I bought the RE650 or AC2600 which talks about being the fastest however speed dropped. The dropping of the speed my best guess is because I could not connect it to the primary router(huawei) as I have airtel and the 5G band in airtel is set to channel 149 or 157 for me. This extender cannot access that channel hence it was kind of useless to me. (the channel change setting was not available in the primary router)The product had a older firmware, had to update the firmware still same issue. Then to check the functionality of the router i had to connect my older Netgear N600 dual band router to my airtel primary router through a lan thus creating a second access point. I could then finally connect to the netgear router and the TP link extender in 5Ghz over band 1 i.e. channel 36, 40, 44 & 48. This critical information is not there anywhere, hence i have decided to return the product. Connecting the TPLink extender with the secondary router over 5G which is connected to my primary router over wired Lan caused a lot of drop in my network speed mainly upload speed.Primary router 5G speed is 170/120(D&U)Mbps, connecting after TP link the speed was 85/20(D&U)Mbps.the Netgear 5g connection speed was 155/100 Mbps when connected directly.There is absolutely no issue with 2.4G and it runs flawless have a very good range, but unfortunately airtel allows higher speed bandwidths only in 5G network and my 2.4G gets max 55mbps when connected to primary router.

This is a very good product! I was hesitant to buy it at first but with the right “device understanding “ using this product would be a breeze. Just an fyi …. To extend the 5 ghz connection your base router should have a channel less than 39.. I have kept it at 37 ( jio giga fiber) and it functions just the way it is supposed to..

Product is very nice and easy to install. Packaging was fine and in very good condition. But price should be less. For Prime members, the delivery of product should take less time. Overall, I am satisfied with the product. Anyone can try without any problem.

reviewTitles: Received but haven’t used as yet
reviewBody: Looks great and packed very well can’t wait to use but haven’t had a change as yet
